trans-unit.source: Represents the container that handles the layout of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> is responsible for handling placement, sizing, drag-and-drop operations, and rearranging of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> controls.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> controls are also responsible for managing the rows (or "bands") in which <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> controls appear.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> may be horizontal or vertical and, like a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu>, is often docked at the top of an application window.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref> class.
Called to arrange and size its <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> children.
The size that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref> assumes to position its children.
The size of the control.
Gets or sets a brush to use for the background color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender%2A>
A brush to use for the background color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Background"></xref> dependency property.
Reads the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.IsLocked"></xref> property from the specified element.
The element from which to read the property.
`true` if the toolbar cannot be moved inside the toolbar tray; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the index number of the visible child.
Index of the visual child.
The index number of the visible child.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> can be moved inside a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.
XAML Attribute Usage
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
`true` if the toolbar cannot be moved inside the toolbar tray; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.IsLocked"></xref> dependency property.
Gets an enumerator to the logical child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
An enumerator to the children of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref> element.
Called to remeasure a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
The measurement constraints; a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref> cannot return a size larger than the constraint.
The size of the control.
Called when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref> is displayed to get the Drawing Context (DC) to use to render the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
Drawing context to use to render the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
Specifies the orientation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Horizontal"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation"></xref> dependency property.
Writes the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.IsLocked"></xref> property to the specified element.
The element to write the property to.
The property value to set.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> elements in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
You can add <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> objects to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> by using XAML, but do not use object element syntax.
That is, do not explicitly specify the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> object.
XAML does not support declaring generic types.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*OneOrMoreToolBarElements*
One or more <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> objects.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> objects.
Gets the number of children that are currently visible.
The number of visible <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
